sentence.Network_en: As they reached the start-finish line Prost jinked right and drew abreast.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他们接近起止线时，普罗斯特猛向右转，两辆车并排驶过了终点。

sentence.Network_en: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

sentence.Network_en: Ellen would keep me abreast of the progress by phone.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃伦会通过电话及时向我通报进展情况。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from a- 'in' + breast

entry.def: If people or things walk or move abreast, they are next to each other, side by side, and facing in the same direction.

example.ex: The steep pavement was too narrow for them to walk abreast.
example.tran: 陡坡太窄，他们没法并排走。

example.ex: ...a group of youths riding their motorbikes four abreast.
example.tran: 驾着摩托车，四个一排齐头并进的一群年轻人

entry.def: If you are abreast of someone or something, you are level with them or in line with them.

example.ex: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
example.tran: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

entry.def: If you keep abreast of a subject, you know all the most recent facts about it.

example.ex: He will be keeping abreast of the news...
example.tran: 他将时刻关注最新消息。

example.ex: We'll keep you abreast of developments.
example.tran: 我们会随时告知你最新进展。

means.word_mean: 1. alongside each other, facing on the same direction
